answers.text:
John – I hope the following is helpful.  Found several cities using smartphones to pay for parking but didn't find anything specific to your request.  But, personally, I think it’s a great idea!
Seattle
http://clerk.seattle.gov/~scripts/nph-brs.exe?d=ORDF&s1=117509.cbn.&Sect6=HITOFF&l=20&p=1&u=/~public/cbory.htm&r=1&f=G 
Miami
http://www.miamiparking.com/en/customers/pay-for-parking/pay-by-phone.aspx 
New mobile app to allow motorists to pay for street parking by phone 
http://www.nydailynews.com/new-york/bronx/new-mobile-app-motorists-pay-street-parking-phone-article-1.1311375 
Article - … pilot cities of Salt Lake City and Austin are making use of the new technology -- mobile payments
This is more economic development focused than city use, but thought you might find it of interest
http://www.nfcworld.com/2013/02/13/322328/isis-releases-utah-mobile-payments-usage-stats/ 
The Alliance uses Intuit by QuickBooks for mobile payments on our iPhones at conferences, workshops, etc but it doesn’t tie-in to the back end systems.
Pam

author: John McCarter
text:
Currently the City of Novi is reviewing our processes for accepting payments for miscellaneous receivables (admission at events and Parks, Posting bond, various charges associated with Police operations, etc.). We are looking to expand our options for accepting alternative means of payment through credit cards, PayPal, payments through an iPhone/iPad and other means.
I’m wondering what methods your departments use for miscellaneous receivables? Do any of your departments have a mobile means of accept credit card payments (an iPhone/iPad app or a hand-held device)?  (For our Michigan Colleagues) Does your chosen solution interact well with BS&A for those who subscribe to BS&A?  
Any information you could provide would be very helpful. Thank you in advance.
John McCarter
City of Novi
Management Analyst Graduate Intern
title: Alternative Payment Methods
